New York University Archives
New York University Evening News RG.39.191
5.5 Linear Feet In 1 flat box, 3 bound volumes, and 3 reels of microfilm
1933-1967 This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the Evening News dating from 1933 to 1967. This newspaper documents local and national news, campus living, student clubs, and student life at NYU as it pertained to the Evening Division of students. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collection includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies. Some issues are bound. Materials in English
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Arrangement
Newspapers are arranged in chronological order.
Biographical / Historical
New York University has had many student newspapers with many different names since its founding. The Heights campus and the Washington Square campus had separate student newspapers until 1973 when the Heights campus was closed. The Evening Division was the designation for students who took night classes at Washington Square College. The newspaper ran from 1933 to 1935 and again from 1943 to 1967.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Researchers must consult microfilm copies when possible due to the fragility of the original newspapers.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date; New York University Evening News; RG 39.191; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains issues of student newspaper the New York University Evening News, also called the Washington Square College Evening News, dating from 1933 to 1967. The newspaper was printed daily and documented student life, university news, and local or international news with relevancy to NYU's Evening Division. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collection includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies. Some issues are bound.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.
Student activities. College student newspapers and periodicals.
